Description of incident: Customers who used credit or debit cards at United States Journeys, Journeys Kidz, Johnston and Murphy, Shi by Journeys and some Underground Stations stores may have had their information gathered during a criminal intrusion of Genesco's computer network.  It is possible that credit and debit card numbers, expiration dates and card verification codes were accessed.UPDATE (01/17/2013): Genesco has spent $2.1 million on consulting and legal fees related to the breach.UPDATE (03/08/2013): Genesco also owns Lids.  Genesco sued VISA for $13 million in unnecessary fines associated with the data breach.  VISA fined banks for their role in failing to comply with industry-wide credit card security standards.  The banks then took money from Genesco to address fines and breach recovery.
